captions.text: Ughh?
(booom)
See, not a problem.

Eh, but I wanted us all to sneak in one at
a time and make the plan stupid elaborate.
Ahhhhh!!!
My face!!
Ok, I'm only going to ask this once.

Are there any exhaust ports that go directly
to the main reactor on this new Deathstar?

because that was a huge error last time and
I do not want it blown up again by some lucky torpedo.
Umm, no sir. No exhaust ports this time.
Completely new design.
Excellent.

Yes, this time there is an even larger opening,
so large an entire ship can fit through it.
Exce--What?!

You guys stole an Imperial shuttle. I mean
is anyone gonna miss it?
Are you sure no one was gonna use it later?
Yes, everything's fine.
How did you steal it?
and how do you know nobody reported it stolen?
Or what if they just let you take it?

Isn't driving a stolen vehicle right past
the enemy extremely risky??
Sounds like a trap to me.
It's not a trap!
Why does everyone think it's a trap?
Many bothans died to bring us this information.

No offense lady, but all we rebels ever do
is die to accomplish things.
Except for the A-team over there.
Why are we so bad at shooting things??
I don't know!!

We're even wearing armor and these e-woks
are still killing us!

Your thoughts betray you. Especially for your
sister.
You have a twin sister?
I have a daughter too??
That is wonderful! I must tell everyone!
Shhh..
I have a daughter, storm troopers!
Eh, you see what you did?

Who knows how long he'll be running around
like that.

Do you realize how annoying it is to put up
with him this way?

Wait a second. You told me I killed Padme
in my anger.
ehhhh, yes.

Well, how did she still manage to deliver
two kids? That doesn't add up.
She.. uhhh.. lost the will to live?
You lied to me!! I'll kill you!
Get over here!
Ahhhhh!!!!
Woohoooooo!!!

Hey, thanks for appearing the way I knew you,
father. Instead of some other version of yourself
I never would have recognized.
I know, right? I mean why would I do that?
I don't know! That's what I'm saying!

I'm just glad you didn't appear as your younger,
more annoying self.

Oh my gosh, that would be so funny, wouldn't
it?

I'd be all, wuhh from my point of view the
Jedi are evil.
Ehh, that gives me flash backs. Change back.
Yes, change back.
Yea, well see ya later!
Well how about this?
(clears throat)
Now this is pod racing!
Uhhhh, do not do that!
Hey hey, look who finally kicked the bucket!
Master Windu, Master Qui Gon!
Hello, Anakin.

Wow, you guys are here too? Wait, does that
mean Padme is here?
She's gotta be here too, right?
No.. just the Jedi?
Well thats pretty wizard I guess.
Well at least we're all friends.
You killed all of us as children.
Awkward, this is.
hehehhehe

you know, I feel like I'm gonna really regret
being blind this whole time.
I bet I'm missing out on some pretty memorable sights.

Hey, thanks for watching! Be sure to subscribe
and watch some more videos!
Ah, get off me!
come on, almost there!
You can do it bubba, here we go!
1, 2, (chomp)
Aw, come on!
Where did that come from?

comments.author: Vanitas Reborn

comments.text:
This just demonstrates how stupidity is a Jedi trait. Yes, despite the fact 
that all they needed to do was retrieve Han, safely frozen in rock-hard 
carbonite, Luke just *had* to come up with a plan that involved all kinds 
of twists and turns, but still ended requiring that they kill pretty much 
Jabba's entire court anyway. Lots of work for nothing a thermal detonator 
wouldn't have accomplished a *lot* more easily!

The whole "lost the will to live" thing with Padme was just Obi-Wan and 
Yoda showing off their complete lack of first aid training (and common 
sense). After all, it's not as if Obi-Wan *saw* Anakin *choking* Padme, or 
how she collapsed onto the hard landing pad when he demanded Anakin release 
her! Oh...wait...he *did* see that. It just never occurred to him that she 
might, you know, actually have been *injured* as a result of it, or that 
subsequently *giving birth to twins* while suffering from untreated 
injuries might be kind of, sorta, hard on her body...﻿

comments.text:
Honest thoughts, I think the reason why they didn't just go in and kill 
Jabba when it would have been easy was out of respect for the Hutts. Let's 
be fair, Han was still a wanted man who ripped off Jabba, and the Hutts are 
the only ones who kept order on Tatooine. Killing Jabba could have, and 
probably has been, pretty bad for certain areas on Tatooine that ran on his 
business. They tried peaceful negotiations first, but Jabba responded with 
aggression.﻿

comments.author: MrPete8680

comments.text:
+MrPete8680 Why would Vader do that? Unlike Luke, Ahsoka's got no chance in 
hell at beating Darth Sidious, even if you gave her decades of training. 
I'd much prefer Vader to be shown to be the cold demon that Episode IV 
portrayed him as, and have him cut her down instead. You could do a lot 
more with that, than with simply rerunning the scene with Luke and Vader. 
I've personally always been of the opinion that nobody but Luke could have 
broken through to Vader. Certainly not Ahsoka.

....Also, Vader saying "Snips" would kill his reputation even harder than 
the big NOOOO at the end of Episode III did.

comments.author: blank blank

comments.text:
+blank blank Not quite. Most of the EU is non-canon, but the Clone Wars 
animated series is still Canon, as is anything that came out after that 
statement, which includes Star Wars Rebels, the Son of Dathmire Comics and 
the current Darth Vader comics. Or any future novels.

As a side note on that comment, I find it rather comical that one of the 
most hamfisted fanboyish moves OF the Expanded Universe (Darth Maul being 
alive) is now Canon, while many far better written works aren't, but oh 
well.

I've also heard people mention a post that stated that the novelizations of 
the movies are still Canon as are any works that cover individuals directly 
referenced by the "core" canon (mentioned above), which would indicate the 
Darth Bane novels and the Darth Plagueis novel are still Canon as well. 
Though I haven't found the statement they reference to confirm this.

And yeah. Ahsoka Tano is very likely to encounter Vader in either the Vader 
comics or the second Season of Star Wars rebels, as she's made an 
appearance and trailers for Season 2 indicate that Vader will be making a 
more prominent appearance as an antagonist (including a clip of him 
casually wrecking Ezra and Kanan), which may result in the two of them 
crossing paths.

hurt Obi-Wan and Obi-Wan's probably still way too raw about it. Remember 
even in Episode IV, he preferred to say Anakin DIED, rather than admit that 
Darth Vader was once the man that had been like a brother to him.
